Class FileList

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FileList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A list of all the files in a particular FileServer.
    See Also:
    FileThread, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileList()
      Constructor that initializes the list class variable.

        public FileList()

    • Method Detail

      • addFile

        public void addFile(java.lang.String owner,
           java.lang.String group,
           java.lang.String path)
        This method adds a file to the file server.
        Parameters:
        owner - The string value describing the owner of the file.
        group - The string value describing the group the file belongs to.
        path - The string value describing where the file currently lives on the users local machine.

      • removeFile

        public void removeFile(java.lang.String path)
        This method will remove a file specified in the path provided.
        Parameters:
        path - The string value of the path of the file to remove.

      • checkFile

        public boolean checkFile(java.lang.String path)
        This method will check if a file specified in the path exists.
        Parameters:
        path - The string representing the path of the file to check for existence.
        Returns:
        Returns a true value indicating if the file exists, otherwise it returns false.

      • getFiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<ShareFile> getFiles()
        This method will return a list of shared files.
        Returns:
        Returns an array list of shared files.

      • getFile

        public ShareFile getFile(java.lang.String path)
        This method will get a file specified in the path.
        Parameters:
        path - The string value of the path of the file to return.
        Returns:
        Returns a ShareFile object of the file specified in the path.
